condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children, parents, caregivers and communities have knowledge of at least three key protective behaviours for children

description.narrative: In 2019, parents and caregivers have their knowledge of nutrition, health, hygiene and sanitation and protective practices increased. Over 59,3 thousand caregivers (58% women, 42% men) of children 0-59 months in drought affected areas had their knowledge in nutrition and hygiene areas increased. In areas affected by Polio outbreaks, 11,5 million people had their knowledge increased on Polio risks and preventive measures, which contributed to the Polio vaccination of 5 million children U5. The work of 19 thousand social mobilizers in 16 of 18 Provinces of Angola were crucial to the achievement of the results. | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/11/2019

title.narrative: Generation and use of social, behavioural and communication data and evidence meets quality standards for informing and monitoring C4D strategies in Country Programme priorities

baseline.value: 1 formative research completed and informing C4D interventions

target.value: 2019:1 formative research completed and informing C4D interventions.

title.narrative: Capacity development strategy under implementation to strengthen and institutionalize C4D skills of government and implementing partners staff at national level and subnational level is implemented.

actual.value: 2019:19 thousand government counterparts and community mobilizers trained to implement C4D interventions
